summary: The Taxpayer Funds Oversight and Accountability Act aims to modify government-wide financial management practices. It amends Title 31 of the United States Code, focusing on the roles and responsibilities of Chief Financial Officers (CFOs). Key changes include requiring agencies to create financial management plans linked to a government-wide plan, strengthening internal controls, improving performance metrics, increasing transparency, and enhancing reporting on financial data. The bill also modifies audit requirements to assess the effectiveness of internal controls.
